most_active_tickets.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI

common_issues.title: LTM Context Not Available in Pieces CLI
common_issues.description: Pieces CLI fails to retrieve context from Long Term Memory (LTM) resulting in a 404 error for the Gemini-Pro model.  This occurs on Windows OS with Pieces OS 11.3.6.  Both CLI and Pieces Desktop chat exhibit the same issue, indicating a problem with LTM integration rather than the specific interface.

related_issues.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
related_issues.text:
LTM not working in Pieces CLI
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces CLI, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Screenshot from CLI:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/949b363d-bbd3-4f3a-b128-5211ca2ef765)

Same question from a chat in Pieces Desktop instead:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d3e98a3-e311-46d3-acba-678e286a4bcd)

Pieces CLI doesn't seem to get the context from LTM.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate LTM integration issues with Pieces CLI on Windows OS version 11.3.6.
Prioritize resolution of issue #713: "LTM not working in Pieces CLI", given its high activity level and potential impact on user experience.
Proactively monitor and address 404 errors related to the Gemini-Pro model in the context of LTM integration.
Improve error messaging and documentation regarding LTM integration issues, including troubleshooting steps for users experiencing similar problems.
Consider adding specific tests for LTM context retrieval within the Pieces CLI test suite to prevent similar issues in the future.
Analyze user feedback and support tickets to identify any other potential issues related to LTM integration or the Gemini-Pro model.
Communicate the status and resolution of LTM integration issues to affected users through appropriate channels (e.g., release notes, support updates).
